interface.name: zriver_status_manager_v1
interface.description: A global factory for objects that receive status information specific to river. It could be used to implement, for example, a status bar.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will not use the river_status_manager object any more. Objects that have been created through this instance are not affected.

request.name: get_river_output_status
request.description: This creates a new river_output_status object for the given wl_output.

request.name: get_river_seat_status
request.description: This creates a new river_seat_status object for the given wl_seat.

interface.name: zriver_output_status_v1
interface.description: This interface allows clients to receive information about the current windowing state of an output.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will not use the river_output_status object any more.

event.name: focused_tags
event.description: Sent once binding the interface and again whenever the tag focus of the output changes.

event.name: view_tags

description.summary: tag state of an output's views

event.description: Sent once on binding the interface and again whenever the tag state of the output changes.

event.name: urgent_tags

description.summary: tags of the output with an urgent view

event.description: Sent once on binding the interface and again whenever the set of tags with at least one urgent view changes.

event.name: layout_name
event.description: Sent once on binding the interface should a layout name exist and again whenever the name changes.

event.name: layout_name_clear
event.description: Sent when the current layout name has been removed without a new one being set, for example when the active layout generator disconnects.

interface.name: zriver_seat_status_v1
interface.description: This interface allows clients to receive information about the current focus of a seat. Note that (un)focused_output events will only be sent if the client has bound the relevant wl_output globals.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will not use the river_seat_status object any more.

event.name: focused_output
event.description: Sent on binding the interface and again whenever an output gains focus.

event.name: unfocused_output
event.description: Sent whenever an output loses focus.

event.name: focused_view
event.description: Sent once on binding the interface and again whenever the focused view or a property thereof changes. The title may be an empty string if no view is focused or the focused view did not set a title.

event.name: mode
event.description: Sent once on binding the interface and again whenever a new mode is entered (e.g. with riverctl enter-mode foobar).
